result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca S. Vandriel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Absolute Sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs.
No Taverns meaning the defendant shall not go on any premises licensed for the retail sale of alcoholic beverages by the drink, which prohibited premises includes taverns.
Shall not possess any alcohol on person, in residence or occupied motor vehicle.

Anger Management Assessment & follow-thru with any recommended treatment or counseling.
Any other assessment/treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Pay Supervision Fees as determined by DOC.
